reactions.name: Sodium Chloride Formation
reactions.description: Formation of sodium chloride from sodium metal and chlorine gas.
reactions.details: This is a highly exothermic reaction where sodium metal reacts violently with chlorine gas to form sodium chloride (table salt).
reactions.safety: Reacts violently. Sodium is highly reactive with water. Chlorine is toxic.
steps: Electron transfer from Na to Cl
Formation of Na⁺ and Cl⁻ ions
reactions.mechanism: Electron transfer from sodium to chlorine, forming Na⁺ and Cl⁻ ions that attract each other to form ionic bonds.

reactions.name: Water Electrolysis
reactions.description: Decomposition of water into hydrogen and oxygen gases using electricity.
reactions.details: Electrical energy splits water molecules into hydrogen and oxygen gases.
reactions.safety: Produces explosive hydrogen gas. Use proper ventilation.
